references.paper_title: Label-free prediction of three-dimensional fluorescence images from transmitted-light microscopy
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the bioimage translation task, showing how to predict 3D fluorescence images from transmitted light.

references.paper_title: In silico labeling: predicting fluorescent labels in unlabeled images
references.reason: This paper is relevant to the concept of uncertainty quantification in bioimage analysis and shows how to predict fluorescent labels in unlabeled images.

references.paper_title: Virtual histological staining of unlabelled tissue-autofluorescence images via deep learning
references.reason: This work demonstrates the application of deep learning to virtual histological staining, a task relevant to bioimage translation and uncertainty visualization.

references.paper_title: U-net: deep learning for cell counting, detection, and morphometry
references.reason: This paper introduces the U-Net architecture, which is a widely used deep learning model for image segmentation and is highly relevant to the image restoration tasks in this work.

references.paper_title: Solving inverse problems in medical imaging with score-based generative models
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the topic of inverse problems and score-based generative models, which are used for posterior sampling and uncertainty estimation in image restoration.
